title: PROCEDURES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This Information Schema view displays a row for each stored procedure defined in the specified (or current) database.
For more information about stored procedures, see Stored procedures overview.
Database which the stored procedure belongs to
Schema which the stored procedure belongs to
Name of the role that owns the stored procedure
Type signature of the stored procedure’s arguments
Maximum length in characters of string return value
Maximum length in bytes of string return value
Numeric precision of numeric return value
Radix of precision of numeric return value
Creation time of the stored procedure.
Date and time the object was last altered by a DML, DDL, or background metadata operation. See Usage Notes.

The type of role that owns the object, for example ROLE. . If a Snowflake Native App owns the object, the value is APPLICATION. . Snowflake returns NULL if you delete the object because a deleted object does not have an owner role.

The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges. The
view does not honor the MANAGE GRANTS privilege and consequently may show less
information compared to a SHOW command when both are executed by a user who holds the MANAGE GRANTS privilege.
The LAST_ALTERED column is updated when the following operations are performed on an object:
DML operations (for tables only). This column is updated even when no rows are affected by the DML statement.
Background maintenance operations on metadata performed by Snowflake.
